thread.title: Tipperary darts player enjoyed very successful year in 2024
thread.title_full: Tipperary darts player enjoyed very successful year in 2024

author: Sports Reporter
title: Tipperary darts player enjoyed very successful year in 2024
text:
Aidan O'Hara
Aidan O’Hara’s performances saw him finish the 2023/24 season at the top of the Irish darts rankings.
This earned him the captaincy of the Republic of Ireland team that went on to win the World Darts Federation European Boys Youths Gold medal in the team cup, and gold in the overall points table.
The Republic of Ireland finished the tournament undefeated. They topped the group stages which included Sweden, Slovenia and Lithuania. Aidan was undefeated in all of his matches.
The Irish team then went on to beat Northern Ireland, Turkey and Wales to earn a place in the final against favourites, The Netherlands.
Ireland triumphed 9-7 in a tense final, with Aidan playing a real captain's part by winning four of his five matches.
Domestically, Aidan added the Irish Matchplay title to the All-Ireland doubles title that he won with Irish teammate Sean McKeon.
The 17-year-old also won nine Irish ADC tour titles and once again finished top of the rankings, which saw him qualify for the Ireland A team for the World Cup in Gibraltar.
His achievements earned him an Annerville sports award, sponsored by Bulmers. He and the other award winners will be honoured by the Tipperary United Sports Panel at the panel's annual function at the Talbot Hotel Clonmel on Saturday night, January 25.
Some tickets for the event are available from Sports Panel member Ken Conway, email conwayken@eircom.net
